SEARCH
Package com.swisscom.tasks.task3.controller

Class ServiceOController

java.lang.Object
com.swisscom.tasks.task3.controller.ServiceOController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/api/v1/services") public class ServiceOController extends Object
Controller for ServiceO entity. It exposes all CRUD operations on ServiceO entity. Http response is HttpResponse object.

  • Method Details

    • createService

      @PostMapping(produces="application/json", consumes="application/json") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<HttpResponse> createService(@RequestBody @NotNull @NotNull ServiceODTODefault serviceODTO)
      Create a new service.
      Parameters:
      serviceODTO - must not be null. It is ServiceODTO object.
      Returns:
      the saved service will never be null. It returns HttpResponse object.
      Throws:
      ServiceOServiceException - if service with same id already exists.

    • getAllServicesDetailed

      @PreAuthorize("hasAuthority(\'SCOPE_SUPER_USER\')") @GetMapping("all") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<HttpResponse> getAllServicesDetailed(@RequestParam(value="page",required=false) @Min(0L) @Min(0L) Integer page, @RequestParam(value="size",required=false) @Min(1L) @Min(1L) Integer size)
      Retrieves all services(All the Details). page and size are optional. It returns HttpResponse object. Each service is ServiceO
      Returns:
      all services. It returns HttpResponse object. Each service is ServiceO

    • getByIdOrAllIds

      @GetMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<HttpResponse> getByIdOrAllIds(@RequestParam(value="id",required=false) String id)
      Retrieves services based on the specified criteria. If the ID is specified, it retrieves a specific service by its ID; otherwise, it retrieves a list of all services with only their IDs.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier of the service to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      An HttpResponse object containing either the service with the given ID (if specified) or a list of all services (only IDs). If the ID is specified, the response data object's 'service' field holds an Optional of ServiceODTO; otherwise, it returns an array of ServiceIdDTO within the 'services' field.

    • updateServiceById

      @PutMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<HttpResponse> updateServiceById(@NotNull @RequestParam("id") @NotNull String id, @NotNull @RequestBody @NotNull ServiceODTONoID serviceODTO)
      Updates the service with the given ID.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier of the service to be updated. Must not be null.
      serviceODTO - The updated service data. Must not be null.
      Returns:
      An HttpResponse object containing the updated ServiceODTO if the service was successfully updated.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the given id is null.

    • deleteServiceById

      @DeleteMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<HttpResponse> deleteServiceById(@NotNull @RequestParam("id") @NotNull String id)
      Deletes the service with the given ID.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier of the service to be deleted. Must not be null.
      Returns:
      An HttpResponse object representing the result of the deletion operation. If the service is successfully deleted, the response status is HttpStatus.OK. If the service does not exist, the response status is HttpStatus.NOT_FOUND. If the deletion operation is not allowed, the response status is HttpStatus.METHOD_NOT_ALLOWED.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the given id is null.
